alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Central Somerset; Coastal Cumberland; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 3:27AM EST until January 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Precipitation will back in from the Gulf of Maine beginning tonight and linger through most of Monday. Temperatures will generally remain at or below freezing resulting in mixed precipitation, including snow, sleet, and freezing rain. While no single precipitation type appears like it will accumulate to significant levels, the combination of precipitation types will likely result in hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations up to two inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting to as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest, west central, and western Maine. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
